Description: Glazed schist commemorative scarab, elytra marked and humeral callosities present, longitudinally pierced, base inscribed with eight lines of hieroglyphs commemorating the marriage of Amenhotep III and Queen Tii.
Curator's comments: A note by Charles Innes Pocock, who donated the scarab to the British Museum in 1854, states that it came from 'Edfou' (AES archives).
Bibliographic references: Blankenberg-Van Delden 1969 / The large commemorative scarabs of Amenhotep III (A11)
Hall 1913 / Catalogue of Egyptian scarabs, etc. in the British Museum (1713)
Exhibition history: Exhibited: 1995 Feb-May, Atlanta, Emory University, Reflections of Women in the New Kingdom 1998/9 Oct-Jun, South Carolina, The Charleston Museum, Queens & Commoners of the New Kingdom
